title: spec: slicing a constant string with constant but out-of-range indices should lead to a compile-time error
body:
"foo"[10] leads to a compile time error, but "foo"[0:10] does not.

The spec does agree with the compilers, but it seems inconsistent.

This is a language change, and code that now compiles may not compile anymore with this
change, but if that code is executed it will lead to a run-time error.
